meanings.definition: A person who caters to the lower tastes and desires of others.
meanings.sent1: The panderer at the party only served junk food to please everyone.
meanings.sent2: The politician was known as a panderer for always agreeing with whatever the crowd wanted.
meanings.sent3: The panderer in the movie made everyone laugh by constantly telling bad jokes.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a panderer to her own cravings, always giving in to unhealthy snacks.
meanings.sent5: The panderer in the story was depicted as a greedy character who only cared about satisfying others' desires.

meanings.sent1: He would panderer to his boss by constantly agreeing with everything he said.
meanings.sent2: She decided to panderer to the audience's preferences to gain more followers.
meanings.sent3: The comedian would panderer to the crowd by using their suggestions in his jokes.
meanings.sent4: The company chose to panderer to the market trends rather than innovate.
meanings.sent5: She realized she had been panderering to her own fears instead of facing them head-on.
